org.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_all, issues.tracker_id AS issues_tracker_id FROM issues INNER JOIN projects ON projects.id = issues.project_id INNER JOIN issue_statuses ON issue_statuses.id = issues.status_id WHERE projects.status <> 9 AND (SELECT 1 AS one FROM enabled_modules AS em WHERE em.project_id = projects.id AND em.name = 'issue_tracking') IS NOT NULL AND issue_statuses.is_closed = "$1" AND (projects.id = 1 OR projects.lft > 1 AND projects.rgt < 10) GROUP BY issues.tracker_id

rewrites.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count_all, issues.tracker_id AS issues_tracker_id FROM issues INNER JOIN projects ON projects.id = issues.project_id INNER JOIN issue_statuses ON issue_statuses.id = issues.status_id WHERE projects.status <> 9 AND (SELECT 1 AS one FROM enabled_modules AS em WHERE em.project_id = projects.id AND em.name = 'issue_tracking') IS NOT NULL AND issue_statuses.is_closed = "$1" AND (projects.id = 1 OR projects.lft > 1 AND projects.rgt < 10) GROUP BY issues.tracker_id LIMIT 1
